column1: #Text=Wikinews interviews Juana Bustamante , Chilean earthquake survivor from Paniahue
#Text=, Chile – Wikinews ' Diego Grez interviewed Juana Bustamante , a Chilean earthquake survivor from Santa Cruz , who lost her home .
#Text=Juana told us her story of what she faced when the earthquake took place .
#Text=The building where she was living fell down while she was on the second floor .
#Text=Héctor Valenzuela , current Mayor of Santa Cruz , has been severely criticized after the earthquakes .
#Text=We are living in tents that the military gave to us .

#Text=There are 22 families here [ over the court ] , and over there by the plum trees there are another 22 , in addition to the ones that are living in the school , and some that live [ over there ] on the other side .
#Text=In total , how many families do you think there are [ who have lost their home ] ?
#Text=What is going to happen to the apartments ?
#Text=Imagine the pain of seeing your home completely destroyed and having to live in the court .
#Text=Has the Mayor , Mr. Héctor Valenzuela helped you ?
#Text=He knows that tons of mice are coming out from sewers over there .
#Text=A few days ago , someone told him that mice were coming out of the sewers .
#Text=" I 'll see later what I can do .
